results.title: [John Robertson Duigan Film Collection: Reel 5]
results.brief_description:
The John Robertson Duigan Collection is a collection of silent 9.5mm home movies filmed by early aviator and engineer John Robertson Duigan (1882–1951). The collection includes a Pathé-Baby 9.5mm film camera and projector owned by Duigan. The home movies provide an insight into the everyday lives of John and his family in Victoria, including picnics, trips to the Grampians and Colac, family snapshots and aeroplanes of the late 1920s.

This short film, originally shot on 9.5mm film, shows a group of people in 1920s fashion walking towards the camera, smiling and posing for the camera with a pet cat and dog. It also features two women with bobbed hair, a child playing with a rattle, and a dog in front of a house.

results.title: [John Robertson Duigan Film Collection: Reel 4]
results.brief_description:
The John Robertson Duigan Collection is a collection of silent 9.5mm home movies filmed by early aviator and engineer John Robertson Duigan (1882–1951). This short film, originally shot on 9.5mm film, features a group of people picnicking on the banks of a river or lake wearing 1920s fashion and a dog fetching a stick in the water.

results.title: [John Robertson Duigan Film Collection: Reel 3]
results.brief_description:
The John Robertson Duigan Collection is a collection of silent 9.5mm home movies filmed by early aviator and engineer John Robertson Duigan (1882–1951). The collection includes a Pathé-Baby 9.5mm film camera and projector owned by Duigan. The home movies provide an insight into the everyday lives of John and his family in Victoria, including picnics, trips to the Grampians and Colac, family snapshots and aeroplanes of the late 1920s.

This short film, originally shot on 9.5mm film, shows a parade with a marching band through a country town past a garage called Bridge Motors (likely Duigan’s garage in Yarrawonga), followed by a couple in a rowboat and a group of people cavorting on the banks of a river or lake wearing 1920s fashion.

results.title: [John Robertson Duigan Film Collection: Reel 2]
results.brief_description:
The John Robertson Duigan Collection is a collection of silent 9.5mm home movies filmed by early aviator and engineer John Robertson Duigan (1882–1951). The collection includes a Pathé-Baby 9.5mm film camera and projector owned by Duigan. The home movies provide an insight into the everyday lives of John and his family in Victoria, including picnics, trips to the Grampians and Colac, family snapshots and aeroplanes of the late 1920s.

This short film, originally shot on 9.5mm film, features panoramic views of the Red Rock Lakes near Colac, Victoria. The film features shots of a man and child on a hill, with the man holding a film camera, and shots of Duigan’s brother, Reginald Duigan, and children outside a large house.

results.title: [John Robertson Duigan Film Collection: Reel 1]
results.brief_description:
The John Robertson Duigan Collection is a collection of silent 9.5mm home movies filmed by early aviator and engineer John Robertson Duigan (1882–1951). The collection includes a Pathé-Baby 9.5mm film camera and projector owned by Duigan. The home movies provide an insight into the everyday lives of John and his family in Victoria, including picnics, trips to the Grampians and Colac, family snapshots and aeroplanes of the late 1920s.

This short film, originally shot on 9.5mm film, features shots of Wannon Gorge and Nigretta Falls (formerly known as Upper Wannon Falls) in the Grampians, Victoria.

results.title: Glimpses of Australia. [No. 01] [excerpt]
results.brief_description:
Spare a thought for yesteryear as you battle your way through peak hour. This except is from taken from a Commonwealth Government newsreel made in the 1920s. It has been digitised from a 16mm film print and digitally stabilised to improve viewing.
This segment has the intertitle “Melbourne” and shows Melbourne CBD, Flinders St Station, Collins St, trams, trains and Parliament House.

results.title: [Remix: ACMI Collection 2]
results.brief_description:
This playful short film set to music, is a tribute to the gems in the ACMI Collection. A remix of home movies and short works from the collection featuring elements on ‘how a movie is made’ and a split screen collage of moving images, interspersed with intertitles. The work was initially designed as part of a fundraising campaign.

ACMI gratefully acknowledge the following donors and creators in the compilation of this work: Australian Dried Fruits Association; John Richardson; Tasmanian Archive and Heritage Office; Ivan Gaal; Wine Australia and Tony Agapitos.
